lines.content: _Kyro_ is a scheduler and chatbot designed to assist you in your daily life.
Its name is inspired by the Greek word _Kyros_, meaning "master". Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/kyro/base/Kyro.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Kyro.main()` (if the
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)
deadline <description> /by <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm>                      --> Add a deadline Task
event <description> /from <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm> /to <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm> --> Add an event Task
mark <task number>                                                --> Mark task by number
unmark <task number>                                              --> Unmark task by number
delete <task number>                                              --> Delete task by number
_Kyro_ is a scheduler and chatbot designed to assist you in your daily life.
Its name is inspired by the Greek word _Kyros_, meaning "master". Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/kyro/base/Kyro.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Kyro.main()` (if the
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)
deadline <description> /by <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm>                      --> Add a deadline Task
event <description> /from <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm> /to <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm> --> Add an event Task
mark <task number>                                                --> Mark task by number
unmark <task number>                                              --> Unmark task by number
delete <task number>                                              --> Delete task by number
* Abstract base type for all executable commands in Kyro.
* Subclasses of {@code Command} implement specific user actions
* Handles the logic for given command input.
* @param tasks   The task list to operate on.
* @param printer The printer used for output messages.
* @param storage The storage handler used to save data.
* @throws KyroException If execution fails due to invalid input
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Printer printer, Storage storage) throws KyroException {

throw new KyroException("Deadline format must be: <desc> /by <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm>");
throw new KyroException("Event format must be: <desc> /from <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm> /to <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm>");

throw new KyroException("Date format must be: <yyyy-MM-dd>");

* Enumeration of all supported commands in the Kyro application.
* Each enum constant corresponds to a valid command keyword
BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, FILTER, FIND
* Main entry point for the Kyro application.
* This class initializes the task list, storage, and printer, and
* coordinates user input parsing and command execution.
* @param filePath File path used for loading and saving tasks.
* Runs the main loop of the Kyro application.
* Continuously reads user input, parses it into commands,
* and executes them until command BYE is given.

* Handles all print output in the Kyro application.
* Provides helper methods for printing messages, errors, and task lists.
System.out.println(" Hello! I'm Kyro, your personal assistant.");
System.out.println(" What can Kyro do for you?");
System.out.println(" Bye. Kyro hopes to see you again soon!");
System.out.println(" Kyro is glad that you have no tasks!");

* Base exception type for the Kyro application.
* All custom exceptions in Kyro extend from this class.
* It provides a standard way to represent application-specific errors.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A {@code Deadline} has a description and a due date/time by which
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by          The deadline in {@code yyyy-MM-dd HHmm} format.
public Deadline(String description, String by) throws KyroException {
throw new KyroException("Date format must be: <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm>");
* Returns the deadline of this task.
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task for display.
* @return A formatted string with type, description, and deadline.
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task for saving to file.
* @return A formatted string with type, status, description, and deadline.
* Represents a task that spans a period of time.
* An {@code Event} has a description, a start date/time, and an end date/time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from        The start time in {@code yyyy-MM-dd HHmm} format.
* @param to          The end time in {@code yyyy-MM-dd HHmm} format.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) throws KyroException {
throw new KyroException("Date format must be: <yyyy-MM-dd HHmm>");
* Returns the start time of this event.
* @return The {@link LocalDateTime} representing the start time.
* Returns the end time of this event.
* @return The {@link LocalDateTime} representing the end time.
* Returns a string representation of this event for display.
* @return A formatted string with type, description, start, and end times.
* Returns a string representation of this event for saving to file.
* @return A formatted string with type, status, description, start, and end times.
* Represents a generic task in the Kyro application.
* A {@code Task} has a description and a completion status.
* Subclasses such as {@link Todo}, {@link Deadline}, and {@link Event}
* Constructs a new {@code Task} with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Marks this task as done or not done.
* @param isDone {@code true} to mark the task as done, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns whether this task is marked as done.
* @return {@code true} if the task is done; otherwise {@code false}.
* Returns the description of this task.
* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is done.
* @return "[X]" if the task is done, "[ ]" if not.
* Returns a string representation of this task for display.
* @return A formatted string with the status icon and description.
* Returns a string representation of this task for saving to file.
* @return A formatted string with the completion flag and description.
* A {@code Todo} is the simplest task type, containing only a description
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* Returns a string representation of this to-do task for display.
* @return A formatted string with type and description.
* Returns a string representation of this to-do task for saving to file.
* @return A formatted string with type, status, and description.
